location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Lord Curzon's Research Correspondence before writing Persia and the Persian Question

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: this file consists of three physical parts. The foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio of part one (ff 1-217), part two (ff 218-405) and terminates at the last folio of part three (ff 406-670); these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file's papers are divided into three sections of loose papers. The papers consist entirely of correspondence about Persia preparatory to the writing of Persia and the Persian Questionwith specialists in the fields of archaeology, history, geography, and other military officials with experience in India and Persia.
